intro: Saccoglossum lanceolatum, commonly known as the lanceolate sea lettuce, is a species of green algae belonging to the family Ulvaceae. It is characterized by its flat, ribbon-like thallus that is typically bright green in color. This algae thrives in marine environments, particularly in shallow coastal waters where it attaches to rocky substrates. Saccoglossum lanceolatum plays a vital role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms. Its simple structure and rapid growth make it an important indicator of water quality in coastal areas.
